title: deeplabcut.extract_frames pop-up image does not close in windows
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
Windows 7, Anaconda Env, DeeplabCut2.x
Browser [firefox]

**Describe the bug**
Call 'deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,'automatic','uniform', crop=True, checkcropping=**True**)' the first pop-up image appears. If you close the image, the code stops working i.e. no message appears and no more pop-up images are opened. If you set' checkcropping=**False**' the code works fine and frames from all movies are extracted. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Call 'deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,'automatic','uniform', crop=True, checkcropping=True)' on a list of movies 
2. Close the pop-up image
3. Interrupt kernel
4. See error

**Error**
Reading config file successfully...
Make sure you change the crop parameters in the config.yaml file. The default parameters are set to the video dimensions.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
```
KeyboardInterrupt                         Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-9-b95afbf50395> in <module>
----> 1 deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,'automatic','uniform', crop=True, checkcropping=True)

C:\Utilities\Miniconda3\envs\fmi-deeplabcut\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\frame_extraction.py in extract_frames(config, mode, algo, crop, checkcropping)
    110                     # Add the patch to the Axes
    111                     ax.add_patch(rect)
--> 112                     plt.show()
    113 
    114                     print("The red boundary indicates how the cropped image will look.")

C:\Utilities\Miniconda3\envs\fmi-deeplabcut\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\pyplot.py in show(*args, **kw)
    251     """
    252     global _show
--> 253     return _show(*args, **kw)
    254 
    255 

C:\Utilities\Miniconda3\envs\fmi-deeplabcut\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backend_bases.py in show(cls, block)
    206                 block = True
    207         if block:
--> 208             cls.mainloop()
    209 
    210     # This method is the one actually exporting the required methods.

C:\Utilities\Miniconda3\envs\fmi-deeplabcut\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\_backend_tk.py in mainloop()
   1071     @staticmethod
   1072     def mainloop():
-> 1073         Tk.mainloop()

C:\Utilities\Miniconda3\envs\fmi-deeplabcut\lib\tkinter\__init__.py in mainloop(n)
    558 def mainloop(n=0):
    559     """Run the main loop of Tcl."""
--> 560     _default_root.tk.mainloop(n)
    561 
    562 getint = int

KeyboardInterrupt: 
```
